Articles.Content:
Rules

Regular Forum Rules Apply

You can't use real Operating Systems. You must make them up.

You can use kerbal relevant words. Such as: Kerdows or Kac.

You can make as much operating systems as you like.

You can't use numbers or anything in settings that are infinity or 100000000000000000000000 or Speed of light.

Example: Speed: Infinity Graphic Capability: 100000000000000000000000000000000000000000 That's not allowed.

Here's how to play

You make up an operating system, And add its Processing power, Speed and Graphic Capabilities. And any other OS Relevant Settings, Such as what Generation it would be. Any other settings relevant you can add.

If someone beats your Operating System's Capabilities and Settings Then the post that got beaten would be : Older Gen and useless. Example: Speed: 100% then someone else posts: Speed: 200% Then you'd be beaten.

I'll start.

Operating System Name: Mustoh Speed: 300% Graphic Capabilities: 100% Capable of newer generation graphics. Graphics Cards: KerVIDIA, KINTEL HD Graphics Family And all other Current/Next Gen Graphic Cards.

GMODOS

Speed: Grahams Number%

Graphic Capabilities: Can render support next, next gen graphics. As in, the 800 series from GTX

Graphics Cards: GMOSS, HD Graphics

not sure what the graham number is so ill try to beat it

Name: Kertsak

Graphic Capabilites: Next Gen.

Graphic Cards: Kosoda KerVIDIA KINTEL HD Graphics Family.

Speed: 400%

Name: JebOS

Speed: 700%

Graphic Capabilities : ability to render all 3D objects quickly

Graphic Cards KerVIDIA and KMD all Kintel graphics are disabled.

Name: Kinux Ubunku

Graphical Capabilities: Will remain valid for the next 5 generations.

Graphics Cards: Custom manufactured graphics card.(16Gb GDDR5 RAM, 4.6Ghz clock, DX 11 and equivilant support PCI x16 Express slot)

Speed: 1500%*

(*Is this viable?)

Name: Kurbonnon Guidance Computer

Graphical Capabilities: Detailed modeling of patched conics and runs Real-World Space Program smoothly

Graphics Card: KerbVidia KerbolXTREME 360 8GB GPU memory with 25 GBPS speed.

General Specs: 32GB GDDR5 RAM, 6.7 GHz overclocking capability, DX 12

Speed: 2100%

Name: PowerMax Excellent Mk1010

Graphical Capabilities: Next-gen vector graphics

Graphics Card: Kerbal with a piece of chalk locked inside

General Specs: Next-gen 1 Hz processor, 32 bytes RAM, DX 0

Speed: 0.000000001%

Jeb's Koperatin

Graphical Capability: Only supporting boosters. Sorry.

Grpahics crad: Boost-XS super

Speed: 300 m/s, and accelerating at 5 G's!

RAM: 600 GB (enough fro B9 and Krag's planets)

Hard Drive Space: 15 GB, you can also buy the Rockomax Super Drive. It's 200 Gb, and costs only 10000 kerbdolars!

Kommander 999Ã¢â€žÂ¢ NXK System

Graphical capability: It draws line graphs at 90 pixels/ms!

Graphics card name: BoostÃ¢â€žÂ¢ -XS2 Superclocked ( Next gen )

Speed: 600M/s tri-ALU with RapidboostÃ¢â€žÂ¢ technology

RAM: 600 Kerbytes of 300m/s inline solid state ram. ( three tubes X 200 kytes)

Hard disk: 25GB of liquid storage. 3000+ Compartments.

General specs: Fully upgrade-able system with the NXK( Next eXtreme Komputer) Assembly system.

Company: Logitell Komputing nation

Duna 2000

Speed: 1023 Mflops. 1.2 GHz.

Graphics: 65 bit polychromatic.

Audio: 31 bit stereo.

RAM: 1025 bytes.

Hard drive: 2^20 lots of 1 MB floppy drives

General Specs: Backwards compatible with all the Duna series back to the Duna 1783. Voted the best "Black Box" flight recording and ms-by-ms replay system in "Crash-and-Burn" magazine 3 times out of 20! Warranty void in event of rapid unplanned disassembly of rocket.

Manufacturer: Palladium Corporation.

b0.0st NG-OS (Next-Generation Operating System)

Speed: 1 petaFLOPS

Graphics: 2048-bit

Audio: 100 bit audio

RAM: 15GB

Hard drive: 50TB QMRD (Quantum MagnetoResistance Drive)

General Specs: Next-generation open-source Operating System for next-generation computers. (WARNING: MIGHT FRY OLDER COMPUTERS DUE TO LARGE DEMANDS)

Company: b0.0st c0rp.

JebOS 95 Plus! Kerbal Explorer

Speed Next Gen. 1995 Processor 60 MHZ 100% as of 1995. 2% as of the person above me.

GPU: Waitek 4 mb

Bill9K (sorry Mekan I have to think one from your series)

Speed: Brain neuron speed (Hey, it wasn't the speed of light!)

GPU: Ketel KD Graphics 20000, can process at the speed of the brain neurons (There's no Intel HD Graphics 20000)

CPU: Ketel Ind. Kore Processor 7240m, can process at the speed of the brain neurons (There are Intel Core processors, but I Kerbaled a bit.)

Audio: B9K Audio Transmitter, 200 bit audio

RAM: Minimum 2048 MB

HD: Minimum 20 GB

BTW, is it possible to go at the speed of the brain neurons?

Edited January 25, 2014 by Designer225

Jeb-Mark 2k

CPU: Kegon i69 12yM (yoctometers, {1*10^-24}) @ 256 PHz (petahertz, {1*10^15})

RAM: 512 EB Octa-Channel DDR12 @ 64 PHz

MB: Kewlett-Jeckerd 1A

Graphics/Audio: Mind-Meld Mk 4 (directly interacts with synaptic nerve endings, alloying kerbals to not only see, but also smell, taste, hear, and touch/interact directly with the programs that are running.)

HD: 8 ZB (zettabyte {1*10^21}) Bio-nerve primary drive for hot memory, with a 1024 YB (yottabyte {1*10^24}) electron magnetic DNA tape database for long term cold memory.

Kerbal interface: Hermal Neural-docked Chair - make 2.1 (HNC 2.1).
